techmeme.title: Google says it has stopped purchasing carbon offsets and is no longer maintaining operational carbon neutrality, but still aims to reach net-zero carbon by 2030 (Akshat Rathi/Bloomberg)
Samsung Electronics's union workers declare an indefinite strike on the final day of a three-day walkout and say management showed no intention of holding talks (Kwanwoo Jun/Wall Street Journal)
Microsoft agrees to buy a record 500K carbon credits from US oil producer Occidental's 1PointFive to offset its emissions amid the AI energy surge (Financial Times)
IDC: global shipments of PCs reached 64.9M units in Q2 2024, up 3% YoY; Apple's shipments rose 20.8% YoY, the biggest jump among global PC makers (Harshita Mary Varghese/Reuters)
Anthropic now lets developers use Claude 3.5 Sonnet to generate, test, and evaluate their prompts, and adds new features, like generating automatic test cases (Maxwell Zeff/TechCrunch)
